currentAffairs.title: Union Budget 2026-27 Presented
currentAffairs.summary: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman presented the Union Budget 2026-27 in the Lok Sabha on February 1, 2026. This marks her record ninth consecutive Budget presentation. The budget focuses on accelerating and sustaining economic growth, building human capacity, and ensuring inclusive development across regions, sectors, and social groups.

currentAffairs.title: Indian-Origin Scientist Veerabhadran Ramanathan Wins Crafoord Prize 2026
currentAffairs.summary: Indian-origin climate scientist Veerabhadran Ramanathan has been awarded the prestigious Crafoord Prize 2026, often referred to as the 'Nobel of Geosciences'. His groundbreaking discoveries on greenhouse gases have significantly reshaped climate science and global environmental policy.

currentAffairs.title: India-EU Free Trade Agreement (FTA) Concluded
currentAffairs.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen officially concluded the India-EU Free Trade Agreement (FTA) at the 16th India-EU Summit in New Delhi. This historic agreement, dubbed the 'mother of all deals,' is expected to provide preferential, zero-duty access for over 99% of Indian exports to the EU market.

currentAffairs.title: Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) Allotted 'Whistle' Symbol for 2026 Assembly Elections
currentAffairs.summary: The Election Commission of India (ECI) has allotted the 'Whistle' symbol to the Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK), led by actor-politician Vijay, for the upcoming 2026 Tamil Nadu Assembly elections. This marks a significant step for the party's formal entry into the electoral arena.

currentAffairs.title: Union Budget 2026-27 Boosts Astronomy Infrastructure
currentAffairs.summary: The Union Budget 2026-27 announced a major expansion of India's ground-based astronomy infrastructure. Plans include establishing and upgrading four key facilities across Ladakh and southern India, with initiatives aimed at strengthening capabilities in solar physics, deep-space observation, and public science education.

currentAffairs.title: Solid Waste Management (SWM) Rules, 2026 Notified
currentAffairs.summary: The Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change has notified the Solid Waste Management (SWM) Rules, 2026. The new framework emphasizes a 'waste hierarchy' prioritizing prevention and reduction, followed by reuse, recycling, recovery, and disposal, and introduces clear penalties for non-compliance.
